titleStmt.title: John H. Nelson et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1808

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: To the Hon Governor of Kentucky

Your petitions would respectfully represent that there is a vacancy in the office of Justice of the peace in the Grants Lick District in Campbell County occasioned by the resignation of Esqr Winston. We therefore respectfully recommend to your honer John H Byrd as a suitable man to fill said vacancy untill another can be Elected by the people & resptfuly pray your honer to Commisson him &c

John H Nelson
C Murrian
C Maddox
Daniel Caldwell
Daniel Thatcher
William M. Gasony
Wm Caldwell
A Shanschery
Foster Byrd
Georg W. Stevens
James H. Smith
Jos. F. Wright
Jno Todd
M Medford Ex. J. P. C. C
John H N
John Burns
Robert Shaw
Wm Barden
Jacob Anderson
John W Stevens
Notley Madox
J C Marris
G R Herndon
J G Clark P C C
John L Maven J. P C C
Robert Hurst
Joseph Lipscumb
Perry Rardin
Geo H Shaw Costable C C
Benj Beall J P. C. C.

Campbell Co
J Peace
Resignation & Appointment
14th Mch/64
